com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.plugins.bluej

Class BlueJPropertiesAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Dictionary<K,V>
      • java.util.Hashtable<Object,Object>
        • java.util.Properties
          • com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.plugins.bluej.BlueJPropertiesAdapter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable, Map<Object,Object>

    public class BlueJPropertiesAdapter
extends Properties
    This class provides a Properties subclass that retrieves properties from BlueJ first, then its ancestor properties object second. It uses an extension proxy object to access BlueJ's property settings for that extension.
    Version:
    $Id: BlueJPropertiesAdapter.java,v 1.1 2007/08/19 03:13:03 stedwar2 Exp $
    Author:
    Stephen Edwards
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • BlueJPropertiesAdapter

        public BlueJPropertiesAdapter(bluej.extensions.BlueJ bluej)
        Constructs an adapter that reads properties from the given BlueJ object.
        Parameters:
        bluej - The BlueJ proxy object to use to store and retrieve property settings. If this is null, then properties will instead be stored locally.

      • BlueJPropertiesAdapter

        public BlueJPropertiesAdapter(bluej.extensions.BlueJ bluej,
                              Properties parent)
        Constructs a BlueJChecker.
        Parameters:
        bluej - The BlueJ proxy object to use to store and retrieve property settings. If this is null, then properties will instead be stored locally.
        parent - The Properties settings to inherit from

    • Method Detail

      • getProperty

        public String getProperty(String key)
        Look up a property value. First, look in this object itself. If the key is not found in this property list, then check this BlueJ extension's stored settings, if this object has a BlueJ proxy object. If there is not an extension-specific value, also check BlueJ's properties. Finally, if the value still isn't found, search the ancestor Properties objects, just like Properties.getProperty(String). The method returns null if the property is not found.
        Overrides:
        getProperty in class Properties
        Parameters:
        key - the property key
        Returns:
        the value associated with the key.

      • setProperty

        public Object setProperty(String key,
                          String value)
        Stores the given property to BlueJ's settings for this extension, if we have a live Bluej proxy to use. Otherwise, fall back to regular Properties class behavior.
        Overrides:
        setProperty in class Properties
        Parameters:
        key - The property key
        value - The value to store
        Returns:
        the previous value of the specified key, or null if it did not have one.

      • getBlueJ

        public bluej.extensions.BlueJ getBlueJ()
        Get the BlueJ proxy object used to look up property values.
        Returns:
        the proxy

      • setBlueJ

        public void setBlueJ(bluej.extensions.BlueJ bluej)
        Set the BlueJ proxy object used to look up property values.
        Parameters:
        bluej - the new proxy to use
